meanings.definition: Shock or excite (someone), typically into taking action.
meanings.sent1: The thrilling movie ending was so galvanising that the audience cheered.
meanings.sent2: The motivational speaker's words were galvanising, inspiring everyone to pursue their dreams.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist in the story was galvanising, making everyone gasp in surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her passionate speech was galvanising, igniting a fire in the hearts of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk was galvanising, pushing the team to give their all on the field.

meanings.definition: Coat (iron or steel) with a protective layer of zinc.
meanings.sent1: The workers were galvanising the metal to prevent rusting.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to galvanise the bridge to increase its longevity.
meanings.sent3: The blacksmith was galvanising the gate, ensuring it would withstand the elements.
meanings.sent4: The construction crew was galvanising the beams, adding a shield against corrosion.
meanings.sent5: The engineer recommended galvanising the pipes for better durability.

meanings.definition: To stimulate or excite (someone) into action.
meanings.sent1: The coach's pep talk galvanised the team to victory.
meanings.sent2: The urgent situation galvanised everyone to work together for a solution.
meanings.sent3: The thrilling competition galvanised the crowd, creating an atmosphere of excitement.
meanings.sent4: The inspiring story galvanised the community to come together and help those in need.
meanings.sent5: The passionate speech galvanised the audience, sparking a wave of enthusiasm.
